content: METAL@ShanghaiTech Junrui LIANG æ¢ä¿ç¿ PhD (CUHK) ASME Fellow, IEEE CASS Distinguished Lecturer Associate Professor ç ç©¶å/å¯ææ/åå¯¼ liangjr (at) shanghaitech.edu.cn Room 526, SIST Building 3 CV (in English); ä¸­æç®å Dr. Junrui Liang has received the Ph.D. degree in Mechanical and Automation Engineering from The Chinese University of Hong Kong (CUHK), Hong Kong, in 2010. Since November 2013, he is with the School of Information Science and Technology, ShanghaiTech University, China, as an tenure-track Assistant Professor and later promoted tenured Associate Professor in July 2021. His recent research interests include: energy harvesting, ambient IoT system, mechatronic dynamics, power conversion circuits and systems, renewable energy, etc. Dr. Liang is ranked among worldâs top 2% scientists the lists released by Stanford University (The list can be downloaded from here) since 2019. As of 2024, Dr. Liang has authored and co-authored more than 170 peer-reviewed technical papers in international journals and conferences. He has received several research awards including the Best Student Contributions Award in the 2008 International Conference on Adaptive Structures Technologies (ICAST), Best Paper Award in Automation in the 2009 IEEE International Conference on Information and Automation (ICIA), Best Information Paper Award in the 2010 IEEE International Conference on Information and Automation (ICIA), and Best Paper Award from 2021 International Conference on Vibration Energy Harvesting and Applications. Dr. Liang is a Fellow of ASME (American Society of Mechanical Engineers), Distiguised Lecturer of IEEE Circuits and Systems Society (CASS). Senior Member of the IEEE (Institute of Electrical and Electronics Engineering), Member of SPIE (International Society for Optics and Photonics), and Member of CPSS (China Power Supply Society). He served as an Associate Editor for IEEE Transactions on Circuits and Systems II: Express Briefs and IET Circuits, Devices & Systems, General Chair of the 2nd International Conference on Vibration and Energy Harvesting Applications (2019). He is the Chair of Energy Harvesting Technical Committee (EHTC) in ASME Adaptive Structures and Material Systems Division, Secretary of power and energy circuits and systems (PECAS) in the IEEE Circuits and Systems Society (CASS), and Track Chair of the International Symposium of Circuits and Systems (ISCAS) 2023 & 2024. He is also a member in the Program Committee of SPIE Smart Structures/NDE conference.
